body:
@dingsongjie Which page? Could you show us some screenshot?

FYI @TinyAllen pay attention about this, if do not exist in RocketBot UI, I think we are good.

1  This is a segment took a total of 83933 ms

![image](http://kan.027cgb.com/620321/%E5%BE%AE%E4%BF%A1%E5%9B%BE%E7%89%87_20190422172925.png)
2   Click to enter details , Show only spans of 450 ms interval

![image](http://kan.027cgb.com/620321/%E5%BE%AE%E4%BF%A1%E5%9B%BE%E7%89%87_20190422172814.png)

3 The span of this page should more than 20

(![image](http://kan.027cgb.com/620321/%E5%BE%AE%E4%BF%A1%E5%9B%BE%E7%89%87_20190422174102.png)

4 I have several pages like this.

5  After a few minutes, I click on the details again , Page changed

![image](http://kan.027cgb.com/620321/%E5%BE%AE%E4%BF%A1%E5%9B%BE%E7%89%87_20190422175203.png)
The log is very clear, your Kafka doesn't support header. We need Kafka 0.11.0.0 -> 1.0, see https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Supported-list.md
The latency is possible because segments are saved in async way.
yes, the underlying kafka-clients is ver 0.11.0.2
Why are there only 20 spans in a segment?  I have a lot of apis like this
Why add this exclusion to fix this issue? @ascrutae I don't expect to do in this way. Could you provide some helps about this bug fix?
SkyWalking  release version 6.0.0-GA

@zhaoyuguang I have talked with @ascrutae There are two things
1. This issue has been fixed already, not elegant, but work.
1. Your change will work(I think), but you don't change `#buildJunction`, which affect the byte-buddy core.
1. Change `HierarchyMatch` makes the API more complex, I have doubts and concerns about the meaning of doing it. Because of (1), we have the method to fix.

Also, in current plugins, we haven't found anything else requires this. So, I suggest abandoning the change this time, and wait to see. @ascrutae supports me about this.
Yes, we only run this in JRE 8, maybe 9 is ok. I am not sure about the status of 11. If you have interests to contribute, we are welcome to support running OAP in JRE 11 or higher.

> Why are there only 20 spans in a segment? I have a lot of apis like this

I don't know why actually. I think should be all.
ok
Ref #443

User wall has been updated.

_____
Where can I find the code coverage report?
The coverage is here, https://coveralls.io/github/apache/skywalking

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/22958748/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/22958748)

Coverage decreased (-0.002%) to 16.007% when pulling **4c94cb5dd892b3eee2ae03c1ccc97d5868cdc3c8 on wu-sheng-patch-1** into **4e50bcf0948d5c026e1099b75f6619087cc9df8d on master**.
Coverage is back as expected.
Why is your service/service instance/endpoint name so long?
@peng-yongsheng I have received several reports about ID too long.
@flycash  In addition to the above points, I also want to monitor the status of the current thread. Of course, it is better that can monitor more thread pool related information.
I don't know much about the dubbo + okhttp. If there is async, you need a new plugin to deal with it.
I don't know what the trace should be, so even you show me the graph, I have no clue. Sorry.

It was a simple dubbo rpc like a -> b.
so  the trace should be  like this pic: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32785355/56643544-67006d00-66ac-11e9-867b-083b39b6bb58.png)


Actually, I use a async http invoke in dubbo. 
My solution is remove the okhttp plugin, it worked.
Thank you for your reply, you can close issue if need.
I am closing. If you active http async, because dubbo plugin doesn't know async, then this shows as two rpc calls. That is why we provide this convenient way to remove some plugin.
Fisrt of all, this is trace ignore, not span ignore. Http client libs are exit spans, which can affect te trace.
This is the normal log. It says, running, in debug level.
@TinyAllen @TinyAllen We need to add ASF header to RocketBot.

Looking forward test case :P
It is an abstract method, you can't enhance that :) JVM rule. If you mean all sub classes who implement this method, maybe try `HierarchyMatch`

See ElasticSearch log, is the cluster alive?

ElasticSearch  is standalone mode. 
ElasticSearch was worked normally all the time. and the log do not have any error, only several gc info log

This is es log:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32785355/56718970-69c59580-6772-11e9-890b-ce6f3c3ea6d6.png)
If too many overheads, then the ElasticSearch may can't support the delete very well. Please add more nodes.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/23015514/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/23015514)

Coverage decreased (-0.002%) to 16.007% when pulling **a96e8e8158560054d70a33f8b0bfff626dae24d5 on ui_submodule** into **9c2d55a4ea4fb400bee2718b154daccb3cff9655 on master**.
SkyWalking should create index automatically. If not, please check startup log.

There is no file called as startup log

All i could see is skywalking-oap-server.log which talks gives the string and error message as below.

2019-04-25 15:29:30,621 - org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.storage.plugin.elasticsearch.base.StorageEsInstaller - 89 [main] INFO  [] - index all_p50_day's mapping builder str: {"_all":{"enabled":false},"properties":{"value":{"type":"integer"},"precision":{"type":"integer"},"detail_group":{"type":"keyword"},"time_bucket":{"type":"long"}}}


Exception in thread "main" ElasticsearchStatusException[Elasticsearch exception [type=mapper_parsing_exception, reason=Failed to parse mapping [_doc]: Root mapping definition has unsupported parameters:  [type : {_all={enabled=false}, properties={precision={type=integer}, time_bucket={type=long}, value={type=integer}, detail_group={type=keyword}}}]]]; nested: ElasticsearchException[Elasticsearch exception [type=mapper_parsing_exception, reason=Root mapping definition has unsupported parameters:  [type : {_all={enabled=false}, properties={precision={type=integer}, time_bucket={type=long}, value={type=integer}, detail_group={type=keyword}}}]]];
        at org.elasticsearch.rest.BytesRestResponse.errorFromXContent(BytesRestResponse.java:177)
        at org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.parseEntity(RestHighLevelClient.java:653)
        at org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.parseResponseException(RestHighLevelClient.java:628)
        at org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.performRequest(RestHighLevelClient.java:535)
        at org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.performRequestAndParseEntity(RestHighLevelClient.java:508)
        at org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.create(IndicesClient.java:99)
        at org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.library.client.elasticsearch.ElasticSearchClient.createIndex(ElasticSearchClient.java:114)
        at org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.storage.plugin.elasticsearch.base.StorageEsInstaller.createTable(StorageEsInstaller.java:96)
